Think: sweet & salty base, gorgeous decadent fudgy middle and a delicious crumble topping. Iâ€™m afraid it does not get better than this. Plus, theyâ€™re a no bake recipe and so incredibly easy to make - so no excuses babe ğŸ«¶

For the base and topping:
â–«ï¸ 200g oat flour
â–«ï¸ 50g rolled oats
â–«ï¸ 50g salted caramel / vanilla soy protein
â–«ï¸ 1 tsp cinnamon
â–«ï¸ 1/2 tsp salt
â–«ï¸ 40ml maple syrup
â–«ï¸ 2 tbsp milk
â–«ï¸ 80g coconut oil, melted

For the middle:
â–«ï¸ 200g dark chocolate
â–«ï¸ 100g peanut butter

1. Mix together all of the ingredients that will form the base and topping. The mixture should be slightly crumbly, but pack-down-able when you squeeze it between your fingers.

4. Return the tin to the fridge for 1 hour. Then, slice up, and ENJOY!

caption:
MEAL PREP BAKED OATS | Banoffee!

We are baaaaaaaaackkkkkkkkk baby

Makes 4â€“5 servings.â–«ï¸ 2 ripe bananas, plus extra for toppingâ–«ï¸ 200g rolled oatsâ–«ï¸ 60g vegan protein (I used salted caramel flavour)â–«ï¸ 1 tsp baking powderâ–«ï¸ 420ml milk*â–«ï¸ 100g 0% yoghurtâ–«ï¸ 1 square dark chocolate

For the date caramel:â–«ï¸ 6 Medjool dates, pittedâ–«ï¸ 1.5 tbsp peanut butterâ–«ï¸ Pinch of flaky saltâ–«ï¸ 50ml milkâ–«ï¸ 100â€“200ml reserved date water

1. Preheat oven to fan 180C.
2. In a 9x6 baking dish (line if yours tends to stick), mash the bananas. Stir in the oats, protein powder, baking powder, and milk until fully combined. Smooth the top and clean down the sides. Bake for 35 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, make the date caramel. Cover the pitted dates with boiling water and leave for 5 minutes. Transfer to a blender with the peanut butter, salt, and milk. Add 100ml of the reserved date water and blend until smooth, adding more water until you reach your desired consistency.
4. Top the baked oats with dollops of yoghurt and caramel, swirl together, then add banana slices and grate over the chocolate.
5. Cool for 5-10 minutes before slicing (this helps the squares hold their shape).
6. Microwave a portion for 1 minute to warm it up, or enjoy cold for an oat-bar vibe. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.
ENJOY!

*If youâ€™re using a different protein powder, you may need to adjust the liquid. Start with 150ml milk and add gradually until you get the same consistency as shown in the video.
